author: Link Zheng (@chillancezen)
Jie Xue (@JieX19)
Hongbin Lu (@fgtdev-hblu)
Frank Shen (@frankshen01)
Miguel Angel Munoz (@mamunozgonzalez)
Nicolas Thomas (@thomnico)
description: This module is able to configure a FortiGate or FortiOS (FOS) device by allowing the user to set and modify system feature and vdom_radius_server category. Examples include all parameters and values need to be adjusted to datasources before usage. Tested with FOS v6.0.0
notes: Legacy fortiosapi has been deprecated, httpapi is the preferred way to run playbooks

description: Token-based authentication. Generated from GUI of Fortigate.
Indicates whether to create or remove the object.
Configure a RADIUS server to use as a RADIUS Single Sign On (RSSO) server for this VDOM.
Name of the VDOM that you are adding the RADIUS server to. Source system.vdom.name.
Use this option to select another VDOM containing a VDOM RSSO RADIUS server to use for the current VDOM. Source system.vdom.name.
Enable/disable the RSSO RADIUS server for this VDOM.
Virtual domain, among those defined previously. A vdom is a virtual instance of the FortiGate that can be configured and used as a different unit.

doc.short_description: Configure a RADIUS server to use as a RADIUS Single Sign On (RSSO) server for this VDOM in Fortinet's FortiOS and FortiGate.

fortinet.fortios.fortios_system_vdom_rad.examples:
- hosts: fortigates
  collections:
    - fortinet.fortios
  connection: httpapi
  vars:
   vdom: "root"
   ansible_httpapi_use_ssl: yes
   ansible_httpapi_validate_certs: no
   ansible_httpapi_port: 443
  tasks:
  - name: Configure a RADIUS server to use as a RADIUS Single Sign On (RSSO) server for this VDOM.
    fortios_system_vdom_radius_server:
      vdom:  "{{ vdom }}"
      state: "present"
      access_token: "<your_own_value>"
      system_vdom_radius_server:
        name: "default_name_3 (source system.vdom.name)"
        radius_server_vdom: "<your_own_value> (source system.vdom.name)"
        status: "enable"

build.description: Build number of the fortigate image

http_method.description: Last method used to provision the content into FortiGate

http_status.description: Last result given by FortiGate on last operation applied

mkey.description: Master key (id) used in the last call to FortiGate

name.description: Name of the table used to fulfill the request

path.description: Path of the table used to fulfill the request
